review: Horrible lunch experience today!  I'll be brief as usual, but besides the quality of the food being ho hum and overpriced, worse yet our server (Kat or Cat) was trite and condesending.  We left her a small gratuity and she attempted to embarass us by asking us LOUDLY  if we wanted our $2.50 back, after we had already told here we did NOT want any change.   My small friday lunch group is known for leaving large tips for excellent service. Today the food and server were sub par and a black eye to this food chain. I hadn't been there in a long while, and now I remember why.
Very good .no complaints. 5 of us had burgers. We have been here in the past, but it seemed better this time. can't say why, it was just good.
Server rule #1, never bring over the check while your guests are still eating. Decent burgers, subpar service. Still tipped 10%, and that was generous..

Excellent variety of choices on the menu.  One of my favorite locations for burgers.  They will still make a "Wise Guy" burger even though it isn't on the menu anymore.  The BLTA Croissant is also another one of my favorites.  We have never had a bad experience at Red Robin.

Where do I begin?   I went here with my family while in town for the weekend.  I usually love a Red Robin and hadn't been in a while, so I was excited to see my favorite meal again and had high hopes for the lunch.   So disappointing in so many ways.   1.  We were seated at a dirty table.   The hostess awkwardly wiped it with a sopping wet rag and then we had to ask her to come back to dry it off.     2.  We were originally seated next to a large corner booth that contained a family with three children, which looked to be between 2 and 4.   Two of the kids were screaming and running back and forth on the seat.  The waitress struggled to hear our order over the racket and finally asked us if we wanted to move.  We were moved about 10 feet away.  Nothing was done about the racket, which continued the entire meal.  One kid was all in the blinds and the other was wielding a plate (waving it around and threatening to throw it like a frisbee).  EVERYONE was staring...all of the nearby patrons plus the staff.  The parents were oblivious.  Management never said a word -- they just continued to stare and let this one table disrupt the entire area (not to mention the safety issue with the kid with the plate).   3.  Two of us special ordered our food (extra ranch on the side for one and no relish on another).  Neither special order was honored.   I asked for ranch again when my meal was delivered.  It never appeared.  I had to ask a third time and was practically done with my meal by the time it arrived.    4.  My wrap was puny compared to what I remember and it was poorly assembled.   The sauces were only on one half and the cheese was only on the other.   Lots of wrap, but not a proportionate amount of filling.   Very disappointing.  My companion's burger fell completely apart with her first bite.    5.  The garlic parmesan fries literally were swimming in grease, but had almost no garlic or parmesan.  I ordered a second batch in hopes of an improvement, but to no avail.   I could have counted the meager bits of garlic and parm.   6.  We had to wait to pay.  The kids were still screaming and we were more than ready to go, but the check was nowhere to be found.    I won't be back.  Ever.

Good variety of burgers, but nothing special stands out at this hamburger joint.  The tables and menu were clean.  The service was OK, but it appears the staff this day was inexperienced and a little unorganized.  However, other times we've been here the service has been good.  The endless fries are a nice idea, but not healthy if your trying to control your weight ;(

Our family loves Red Robin.  It is usually our first choice.  It is certainly the place for a family or any group that wants to have a good time to go.  However, my experience as a solo diner has been disappointing.    they have remodeled the bar and this seems to be where solo diners are steered.  Prior to the renovation, I had a couple of sour experiences where my burger would be brought from the kitchen, but just after it got placed and they left, I realized I had to run down condiments and utensils on my own.  While the bartenders are all great folks, attending to the meals of their customers is not their first priority.  They have to mix drinks for the other servers and answer the phone for customer calls and takeout orders.  I did not want to wait for my great burger to get cold waiting for salt and pepper. tonight was the last straw.  The lobby has also been renovated, so there is no doubt that any customer standing there is waiting to be served. I entered tonight and saw a meeting of four people huddled around the hostess station.  There were no other customers waiting.  Only one person even noticed I was there, but she merely looked up and quickly returned her gaze to the meeting. No acknowledgment 'welcome to red robin, be with you in a moment'.  All I saw were employees backs and the top of their heads.  After a minute, I gave up and went to the bar to find a seat. I noticed the bartender, busy fixing drinks, and helping a waiting customer with a to-go order.   There were no other servers helping in the bar and no effort was made to acknowledge me.  I waited for about 5 minutes, then just grabbed my stuff and left.  as I past the hostess station, I told the person I was being ignored so I am leaving. it was early on a Thursday evening.  the parking lot was fairly empty and I saw a lot of servers. I remember coming in, holding the door for a Mom carrying a baby, yet thinking where are the hostesses that are normally swarming around the door. I've been coming here since they opened, but now looking back over the past 15-20 visits the last 10-12 weeks, I have not had a manager once stop at the table to ask about the service. I called back later from the restaurant. that I went to instead to tell the manager they lost a customer tonight and why.  I think the four person huddle at the hostess station was one of the managers having an employee pow-wow.  Don't distract your servers by having meetings like that.  the employees have to give the boss the attention they demand, but in this case, the customer was ignored, forgotten and in my case - gone.  No sale for the business, no nice tip for the server.
All new design this Red Robins is looking to cater to an older crowd for late nights while being kid friendly for dinner. Now a very modern/ intimate theme. Very quality food for a respectable price.

Had lunch here.  Silverware was dirty. Ordered fish and chips. Took forever to get meal. When it came it had obviously been sitting since it was barely warm and the fish had turned soggy on the bottom from condensation. Had to ask three times for extra napkins. Waiter asked if I wanted malt vinegar. I replied yes but it never arrived.

Horrible service and poorly trained staff!!!!  After my party was seated they said our server would be right out. Nothing new, but it took them ten minutes for anyone to approach our table after multiple server walked by our table, including the manager, and he actually took our drink and appetizer order. I also explained to the manager it was a special night, we had a birthday in the group. When our server, Becca, finally came around to our table she apologized, by giving us an excuse of not knowing she was our server, even though we sat right next to a table she was chatting up for at least ten minutes at a time. After the order was placed, she was gone, very inattentive even though drinks were empty and the appetizer was gone. When the food came out she stoped in three times which once was asking about how we were going to split the check. At the end of the night the management never once came back to the table to see how the rest of the night went.  Horrible first impression and lack of professionalism all around!!!!

Yummm!! Diving through the area on our way south.  Found this place by accident.  If I had an accident like this every day, I would be in heaven.  Attractive friendly greeter at the door sat us at booth in the bar section, in other words no kids.  I quickly looked for the burger section of the menu.  Burgers like this you just can't make at home, but I'm trying.  The selection was great, every type of burger you could imagine.  Too many to make a quick choice.  They all sounded great.  The experience was good as was the atmosphere.  I would recommend this place and hope that their other locations  are just as good.   Don't forget they have bottomless fries.  The ones we got with the burgers spent a little time under the heat lights and were pleasantly crispy.  Our second came right out of the fryer.  Scorching hot but somewhat softer.  I think I liked the crunch of the first batch, but both were great.

Food is great, but they don't know how to accommodate guest. They put my twins in car seats, my friend, her 4 year old son, and I right next to another family. The whole place was empty I couldn't even move back or I would bump the person's chair.  Other than that it was ok. Oh and employees need to learn how to drive in a parking lot. She was speeding down the parking lot and never even looked up at us as she swooped by and almost hit us, it was our waitress too. Wanted to go back in and get the tip I left her.

Came here on a Wednesday night around 8pm and the place was dead... that should have been a red flag. The service was horrible and so was the food. I am not usually a fan of chains to begin with, but my boyfriend has an obsession with one of their burgers, so time to time I will indulge him. Our appetizers came out literally 5 minutes before our entrees.... which was annoying. We were left with the choice to let our entrees get cold and eat our appetizers, or abandon our overpriced apps for our entrees. Not a choice anyone should have to make! And our strawberry lemonades had maybe two strawberries each... not impressed.
Overpriced, poor service and below average food quality.  Need I say more about this place?  Much better burger places around at more reasonable prices.

Food was good but our service was HORRIBLE! It seemed like an eternity for our server Aleeya to bring out our drinks, which was nothing complicated - we ordered 3 waters. Well it only got worse from there. When she came back, we put in an order for some guacamole and chips along with our food. Our appetizer never came, just our food. So we told the server who brought our food out to just cancel the appetizer. Maybe 5-7 minutes after getting our food, she comes over and was like "oh I was told your appetizer never came out. Don't worry I'll remove it from your bill." No sh*t Sherlock! We weren't going to pay for something we never got. Well she didn't come back to our table for another 20 minutes - our fries had been gone for bout 10 min and we wanted more and my daughter needed a refill - when she did come back, this worthless server was coming to bring us our damn check and quickly put it away when we asked for more fries and a refill. Where does the damn customer training they supposedly get come into play!? Then when we finally ask for our check, she gives us someone else's bill (more than what our real bill was) which she apologized for. Not only was she terrible, a different server, Jason, brought me a refill which I didn't ask for. Its apparent that she needs to take some notes from him on how to provide customer service. After I paid, I asked to speak to the manager when we were headed out. Manager came over and I explained about the horrible service we received and all she said was "Oh I'm sorry that happened. It must be an off day for her because she's one of our best servers." Really that's all you do, just apologize!? But then again, even if she offered a discount on our next meal, we wouldn't have used it because this experience alone is enough to have us go elsewhere. We will never eat at this Red Robin again. Unless you want bad service, I would NOT recommend coming to this establishment.

Waited for exactly 25 minutes at our table with our kids and no one even asked if we had been helped or got our drink order. The funny thing was the place was really slow because it was 2pm. Our family ended up leaving after talking to the manager, our kids were upset we were leaving but after hearing them complain about being hungry and thirsty for 25 mins we were fuming and left!  Have never had this experience with red robin and was very disappointed. Tables were very dirty as well.

Stopped here for a burger and a soft drink after shopping. Burger was delicious, but was royally ripped off on my SOFT DRINK.  I can never finish the giant sodas restaurants serve so I ordered a child's drink. My drink was served in an 8-oz glass. Because I don't like watery drinks, I asked for it without ice. The server brought the 8-oz drink with ice. I reminded him that I had requested it without ice so he took it back and returned with the drink I ordered.  Red Robin charged me $2.96 for an 8 oz. child's drink.    When I voiced a complaint (via email when I got home and realized I had been seriously overcharged), the manager told me there was nothing he could do because I had ordered off the regular menu.  I never looked at the menu.  Red Robin - Cosner's Corner management should be ashamed for price gouging.  Red Robin - Cosner's Corner cheated me, and has no intention of making things right by refunding the overcharge.

Red Robin, aka The Dirty Bird is amazing in itself!  Food, drinks, overall experience is fantastic across the country!  This restaurant, in Fredericksburg is above all!  Great atmosphere, speedy and cordial service!  Anna did a fantastic job!  Thank you so much!
burgers are always good as well as the fries. do not get the red velvit cake its horrible and a waste of money.

While FLAWLESS describes my first Red Robins experience perfectly, my second visit to this specific chain didn't quite live up to my expectation.  As far as service goes, I can't recall it being anything other than terrific... Then again, I have always been in a great mood whenever I visited this place because I was fortunate enough to be in the presence of some amazing company. Their presence definitely enhanced my entire experience at Red Robins each and every time! Unfortunately, unlike my first visit, today's bottomless sweet potato fries left me utterly unsatisfied. Due to the fact that the fries were mostly burnt, the taste was far from its typical crisp and freshness. I made two orders of the fries in hope that the Fries Chef would redeem themselves by serving up a blazing hot, crispy (on the outside), soft (in the inside), and simply mouth-watering batch of fries but the second batch was as disappointing as the original one that came along with my Sautéed 'Shroom. Speaking of which, this was one of the greasiest burgers I've had at Red Robin. During my first visit, the Crispy Arctic Cod was so delicious that I inhaled the entire burger and fries in less than 10 minutes. To reiterate, the 'Shroom was overly greasy and the fries were burnt, which leave A LOT to be desired. I won't be returning any time soon. The taste of my horrific meal still lingers quite strongly. Until that fades away, I can't imagine myself working up an appetite for more Red Robins in the near future.

Never had a bad burger here. Lately I have been ordering the smoke and pepper burger which is awesome!. The service has alway been nice and keeps you drink filled.  The only reason no 5 stars is because the pretzel bites came with the smallest cheese ever and they sat us at a 2 top with a high chair and there was not enough room for 3 plates of food with drinks and appetizer. Overall good atmosphere good food good service and will be abck

Called in a to-go order this afternoon. Was left on hold for 8 minutes before I even placed my order, it wasn't the middle of the lunch rush which would have been understandable but two in the afternoon. I arrived to pick up my order about 10 minutes after calling in, it wasn't ready. So I waited and waited and waited... 20 minutes later my order was ready. I paid and left. When I opened the two boxes a mere 5 minutes later the fried zucchini and French fries I ordered were incredibly unappetizing. The zucchini was a huge, mushy chunks with almost no breading. The fries were cold and mealy, as if they had been sitting out for a long time. Since this is the first time I've had such unappealing food served to me by Red Robin I'm giving this location a 2 star rating, hopefully there won't be a repeat of this issue.

This is most definitely the last time I step foot in this Red Robin. If friends from other areas want to go to one where they live I will join them but never again will I go to the Red Robin in Fredericksburg. Went there this past Friday night and as a member of their rewards program my wife had a coupon for a free burger. Server was nice. She asked if we were members of their reward program. We said yes and told her we're eligible for a free burger.  My wife ordered one of the "Red Robin's Finest" burgers. We were served our meals. Now I want to add that the burger was ordered cooked "medium". However, it was delivered "well done". If I were paying for it I definitely would've sent it back. Instead, we reasoned that It's free so why complain. We ate our meal and out comes the check... The server says, "Unfortunately, the burger you ordered is a premiere burger and it doesn't qualify for your free coupon. But your coupon is still good through the end of the month ago so free to come back before then." EXCUSE ME?? Why are you telling me this now and not, say, before you told your cooks to make it, then serve it to us, and let us eat it?!  I ask to see a manager. The manager comes over and apologizes but takes the server's side. "My server says that you didn't tell her about the coupon until after the order was placed." WRONG. But I'm staying calm and say, "Well can I just pay the $3-$4 difference between the burger we ordered and one that we were eligible for?" She says, "No we can't do that. But I'd be happy to have them make you a free item on the menu to go." So let me get this straight? You'd rather give us a free $10 item rather than take the $3-$4 difference I offered? I declined her offer, saying that we were full, have plans with friends after this, and are not gonna wait around for food that's just gonna sit around making my car stink while I'm doing everything else I was going to do on Friday night. Manager was no help. I believe she thinks she handled it the right way, but this is the hospitality business and you failed. Server was borderline dishonest most likely to save face in front of her manager. Food was good but not great. That's the last time I ever go to this Red Robin. Sidenote: I have a soft spot for servers that work hard, are friendly, and try to make an honest living. When I really appreciate good service I tip around 30% but very rarely do I ever tip below 18% because it really is a very hard job. In fact, I told my wife before this debacle began "I'm going to leave this server a $7 tip (which would be 100% since my meal was $7 and my wife's burger was supposed to be free) That, of course, did not end up happening. Maybe 5 times in my life have I left a 10% or lower tip because of bad service. 2 of those times were at this Red Robin in Fredericksburg. Lesson learned.

I've ate here a couple of times. But this most recent pretty much ticked me off so I'll never want to go back. Not only is the food overpriced, but the service is below par. As a former restaurant server, I can say that I have never seen such a lack in customer service as I have here. Short story: We ordered an appetizer that we never got because the server forgot to put it in the computer. He did apologize, still brought us the appetizer but suggested that we tell the manager ourselves about the mishap if we wanted to get the app comped. Ummm...excuse me? Since when is it the customer's responsibility to fix a server's mistake? The manager did come over to our table with the app, dropped it off, never apologized or said a word. She was incredibly rude to say the least. In the end, we got charged for the appetizer and the server's mistake. Unfortunately for him, it reflected on his tip. As for the food..it was fine. To be expected, but not worth the money. I'd rather go to Five Guys.

I very much enjoy the food, but the service has gotten progressively worse everytime I visit.  I understand being busy but the servers lose track of tables, service is slow and frankly the staff acts like they just don't care anymore.

This was my first time at this location. Our waitress started out nice enough but then she seemed as though something had upset her. She was short with a few of her tables. As for the food the chicken sandwich I got was delicious only it was a little rubbery. One portion of it was so rubbery I couldn't eat it. I would recommend this location if you have some time to kill and you're looking for something quick.

The service here is absolutely horrible! Took my daughter in today for her birthday with a free kids meal coupon but because I didn't print it they wouldn't take it and didn't tell me till the end of the meal even though I showed them when we first arrived. They over charged me for a side salad and when I asked to have it fixed the server rolled their eyes, very prominently at me. I had many choices of places for my daughter to get her bday dinner but chose here because they sing and make a big deal. We didn't so much as get a balloon. She was very disappointed and I was upset because I could've gone somewhere else. This is the third and final strike with this place. I'm done with the entire red robin experience. Don't waste your hard earned money.

My service wasn't bad as some other reviewers have stated, but these are advertised as "Gourmet Burgers".  The meat tasted like it was a frozen patty (like a bubba burger) and the toppings weren't that great either.  We came out wishing we had gone to the 5 guys across the street.

Red Robin Fredericksburg has steadily gone downhill since opening. We used to enjoy it, but my husband and I both decided tonight will be our last visit to Red Robin. Icing on the cake was being served our appetizer with 3 wet appetizer plates.  Over priced, mediocre food, less than stellar service. Won't be going back there.

Wife wanted to come here I didnt. I asked for the wings, I got the boneless. I asked for the ghost tavern, and they gave me the wrong one. Took 45 mins to get food and had to wait another 15 to get the right burger. Terrible variety of food. Unless you're 12 this isn't the place for you.
Get rid of your Ziosks and hire some more servers. The few that are here are running around busting their butts. It is not fair to the employees and definitely not fair to paying customers.

If they ever was reason to not patronize a restaurant today's experience would be be a prime example.  1st the staff was more concerned about a dog locked outside in the car than seating patrons in an empty restaurant.  2nd 7 dollars for (a cup of) Queso and chips (even after the extra chips) is bullsh*t. 3rd if a customer asked for a pub burger, cooked medium w/ mushrooms. It does not mean serve rare and greasy.  Good cut of ground beef does not need oil to cook.  Congrats I have just marked another place in Fredericksburg off the list.

Went here recently with a group of 12 people for a birthday luncheon. Service was good, especially given that it was about 12:30 ... the traditional lunchtime rush. But, now to the food: the best I can say about it was that it was ... meh. I asked for a medium rare burger and, instead, received a very well done one that was totally ordinary in every way. "Gourmet" ... definitely not! The sides were nothing special, except that the french fries were way over-salted. Pretty much everyone else in our group was underwhelmed with their orders, too. If only the food here looked even a little bit like the photos in the menu! Gosh, I used to love Red Robin, but it seems that this chain has hit its peak and started sliding down fast. All things considered I could have gone next door to Famous Dave's and had a better burger or its excellent BBQ.

The food was great so delicious but the service was decent order a drink for my wife server said didn't had cus it was not in the menu but it was my wife went to the bartender to ask and bang she got her drink.the brew was good.every one else food was satisfied with their.dont know if I ever come here again.server service poor they can do better.

I broke my promise and actually did go back to Red Robin. A business associate really loves this place and suggested it for a business lunch.  This was (almost) like a completely different restaurant. While the hostess was under-trained and a little unsure of what to do, the rest of the staff was very good.. The service was friendly and prompt, food was excellent, and the price was reasonable. In addition, the place was clean.  I'm glad I went back.

Food was Good, Service was good, THE PLACE IS A PIT! Disgusting Bathrooms, Crap all over the floors, several of the service staff look rather slovenly and unkempt. We were not impressed with the overall experience mainly because I had to question the actual cleanliness of the kitchen and the staff based off what I saw on the main floor. The Kiosks on the table were fun but it replaces the effective server and does their job for them.
This place used to be really good. The burger we cold I had like 8 fries. Never got my onion rings. Probably won't be back and it's ad because we really like red robin!

I used to like this place alot but I found on the past two visits that the quality has gone down hill.  The burgers feel pan fried and the bread taste comertial (flat and days old).  THe Chicken strips and fried foods are all very greesy and smell of old fryer oil.  It is not as good as the other franchises of this sort in town.

Brought us daiquiri sauce instead of strawberries for the kids side.  Said they were saving the good strawberries for the drinks!  Huh!  The picture on the menu blatantly has strawberries as one of the fruits in the freckled fruit medley.  Oh and I only got the sauce after complaining twice!  Never going back.  Hell they wouldn't even comp the kids meal.

It's amazing how the commercial on TV can drive your senses to eat at their place of interest, but as I sat here I remembered that it's their fries that are delicious when presented with fresh hot ones.  Whatever they use as their house sauce in the bottom of the hamburger does not taste well for me.  I want mayo and ketchup the old fashion way.  I need to remember to put Burger King on the front burner when I consider coming back again.

Our server Terri was slamming.  She had our drink orders before we opened our menus.  My burger was cooked perfect and simply delicious.  We also shared a couple apps.  What a delicious way to begin a meal.  Although slightly over priced.  Wanna a delicious  , it's worth every dime.

The host seemed upset when we said no to his suggestion of sitting at the bar. He said there were no tables because there was a big party there, but when we walked back there were at least 6-7. The waiter was okay, but much better than the host. Food arrived quickly and the burgers were decent. The meat was over cooked, but the toppings and bun were good.  The place smells bad. Like old bleached mop water and stale beer. Do yourself a favor and walk across the street to Five Guys. We will not go back. I should have turned around and walked out when the host acted like a child.

Has gone way downhill.  Servers are untrained.   Prices are up.  Delapidated tables.  In 2010 I gave this place four stars.  Now it was a stretch to get to two stars but the burgers are mostly pretty good. Better burgers can be had at locally owned restaurants and pubs nearby like The Tavern

Food was good but food services were sloooow. We ordered our second round of fries.. Yes only the second round half way through our meal and still didn't get them 10 minutes AFTER finishing dinner. Walked out very upset, our bottomless fries got bottomed out.
Waitress was rude and manager seemed unconcerned.  The food and root beer floats took forever. Will not be back!

My burger was delicious but the service was TERRIBLE. I had to remind my waitress many times about items she kept forgetting. We also waited 45mins-1hr to be seated, but it seemed like no one was in there. I'll go back JUST because my food was good. Carry out instead of dining in.

We stopped here to avoid rain after Ladysmith Days.  Not bad, food was ok as usual.  We were there around 5 pm-ish.  On a Sat evening. Lobby was FULL of families, LOTS of empty tables but hardly any employees. There were TWO hostesses but no servers?! We at in the bar, wanted to sit AT the bar, but the counter top was full of empty plates, glasses, etc. One VERY pregnant bartender who obviously didn't want to be there.  She moved slower than my grandson being forced to clean his room!  We had the the bearded guy.  He didn't move much faster, but he did show SOME attention to us and the other 4 booths.  We had the only high-top.  There were several empty booths which could have held several families in the lobby. My main complaint was he brought the wrong beer.  I had Devils Backbone and hubby had Eight Point IPA.  When we ordered a 2nd round, we got 2 Backbones.  Hubby refused to drink it he ONLY drinks IPAs but we had no water! Never saw the guy again so we paid and left. Needs a serious overhaul.  When you spend $55 for two burgers and 4 beers, yes we got charged and I just drank the mistake; I kind of have preconceived notions of how customer service should be.  We won't be back to that location. Corporate and GM really should take heed of the many negative reviews.  We stopped because of hunger and we LOVE the Potomac Mills location.
Waitress was a bit overwhelmed (though not sure on what since the restaurant was pretty empty) Food was good though....I always love a good Red Robin burger

I will never return to this location again. The management here is invisible....they never stop at your table...they never ask how was your experience and they most definitely never correct their mistakes!! This was the second time that I was told incorrect information and the managers refused to correct the matter.I am a long time patron of red Robin but this location is off the list. I will be traveling to any other location to get a burger and that sad's because this location is 5 mins from home! If you are looking for a family friendly restaurant in Fredericksburg, don't stop here

This visit in early April was one of our better trips to Red Robin.  The server was friendly and fantastic, and our food was great. We both had the smoke and pepper burger which was juicy and delicious. The pepper bacon was amazing, and the burgers were cooked perfectly. Our server was quick to refill drinks before we ever had to ask.

we gave it another try, on the restaurant side. We got much better service, ( and the server had a large party  to deal with) an ample amount of fries this time.     The food was good, place still clean!!

This 5 star review is based on a server, named Jordan, that is absolutely amazing!!!  The restaurant is clean, staff is friendly enough, prices are good, no complaints about the food and the garlic parmesan fries are ridiculously delicious. All of that said, Red Robin almost lost our business based on a horrendous server experience. Jordan was new at the time. We stopped him as he was passing our table to see if he could help us, in place of our inept waitress, and he was happy to help. Each time we have gone back, we have requested him and have nothing but a positive experience! I sincerely hope that management recognizes outstanding employees, such as Jordan, that make the difference in an area over populated with other dining options. If I owned a restaurant, I'd steal him away in a minute! :)

I think they provide great service and fine food. You definitely get a bit more than expected here. However, their listing says a pokestop is nearby and that's patently false advertisement. Sure, "nearby" is a subjective term, but I think by any standards they're lying on this point.

I really want to Love this restaurant.  The food is great. It has things to do for kids, the concept is fabulous.  We've been several times and the issues are always the same. Lack of service. I mean bad service.  Sometimes it takes an hour to get your food. On one occasion half our party walked out.  The last visit (thought we'd give it one more 'last chance') we had a large party and our food came out cold and missing items.  Sadly that was truly our last attempt at giving this location another chance.

After reading the other reviews and then still giving it a try, I can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised with my visit here. Everything was good! We waited about 20 minutes for a table. They were packed because of a holiday but they seated people with appropriate wait times.  Our waitress was pleasant and got us everything we needed. Our food came out fast and everything was hot and delicious. I got the regular cheeseburger with blue cheese. Of course I had to take advantage of the "bottomless fries" and those came out fast too. Yum!  The atmosphere is nicely decorated. There's a lot to look at. This restaurant seemed pretty kid friendly with chalkboard games for kids (or adults) to play on Unfortunately I'm taking off one star because our table wasn't the cleanest when we sat down. We had to wipe some crumbs off. This place is definitely worth a try!

We arrived at Red Robin and was given a time to wait of 20 minutes and was told we would be texted when our table was ready. Our table was finally ready after 40 minutes, and a group of 6 that missed their call was rushed in front of us. After getting seated, the server was very nice and made sure our drinks and our food was correct. The food came out quickly and was fresh. Our second order of fries were not the freshest but were still warm and tasted o.k. Much better experience than ours in Memphis. The location was clean and people were served promptly.

Worst service ever.  Sat in the bar area to enjoy an adult only space.  Server was non existent for first 15 minutes we were there--had drink order taken by the hostess that sat us after she realized we were being ignored.  She brought us our drinks and then we sat some more.  Finally our waitress appears, takes our order and disappears.  Food is brought out by a "manager"...she asks if we need anything else (no sign of waitress)--food was average--never asked if we wanted more fries--had to ask for them ourselves.  While we were there NONE of the tables had been bussed--the entire bar area was full of plates, glasses, used napkins etc.  Is there actual management here?  Other patrons were waiting for seating because nobody cared enough to clean tables.  People seated outside came in to see where their server was.  Total fiasco.  Definitely not coming back anytime soon.

Second chance for this place, will not be a third. Restaurant decent, bathrooms decent, service was quick and friendly. Emptied the ketchup bottle, found two more they were also empty, third was a charm with about 1/4 left. Burger was square, not large, not thick, not juicy. I had a slice and half of mushroom, don't even recall any onions, saw cheese but it didn't look or taste blue. Not worth $14.95. $3 tops. Fries are ok, gave you a few because they're "bottomless" takes awhile to get more and then once again it's just a few. Go across the street to Arby's.
Seated quickly and were promptly greeted by our waitress and her trainee!  Food was to be expected hot fresh fries and tasty burgers!  We will be back
The food is always great, the staff always on-point, and the atmosphere lively! Highly recommend this Red Robin restaurant!
Just walked out- sat at a table for 10 minutes, the wait staff never approached us.  I've also had issues in the past with to-go orders...

Red Robin now claims that their veggie patty is "ancient grain quinoa, made in-house." LIES!!! It's a frozen black bean Boca burger. It's the same frozen veggie-option they have always had, just marketed differently. I asked for a "Keep It Simple" veggie burger, add onion straws. I was disappointed that it was the frozen veggie option, and the onion straws were limp and cold. One OK thing, was the side of Sweet Pepper Thai sauce, which did have a spicy kick, brought some flavor to the burger.  Jordan and I were here because we were with more meat eaters than veg-heads, and Red Robin "has options." Well - it has an OPTION. Singular. Not plural. And it's not even a good option. Chili's. Applebee's. Red Robin. All of these places are practically the same, just different decor. It's poorly assembled frozen food, with barely aware wait staff.  God - please get me back to the city with independently owned restaurants!!!

Wow. Bad service from Ms. Leila at the bar. I was served my red wine in a dirty glass after pointing it out to Leila she rudely took it out my hand, never apologized and poured me a new glass. Poor Customer service. Never spoke a word to me. Very rude.  Bad service. I gave your location a shot. Leila cost you repeated business.

This was such a disappointment!!! Red Robin has always had great service and great food. My friend had never been in a Red Robin now will most likely never go again. My friends burger was burnt,the wait staff was rude, never even asked us if we needed anything after we finally got our food.  They were having a fund raiser that night well no one from the funds raiser even came to our table to hope to get donations.  Worst experience ever!!!!!

Red Robin always has good food and they strive for good service. According to the manager, we didn't get the "Red Robin experience" after we weren't greeted right away and had a mistake in our order. However, the manager made it right while his staff tried to help out as a team. We'll definitely be back!

We just left here and it was terrible. Nobody was manning the front so after waiting several minutes (with several workers looking over at us standing there) we decided to seat ourselves. We called a waiter over using the tablets on the tables, and then had to wait forever for our drinks. We had to go search for a high chair for our baby. The waitress never asked how we wanted our burgers cooked and then our entire order never even came out. We sat with empty glasses for some time before getting a single refill. At the end we were waiting for them to remove items from our bill that never made it to the table and waiting for a box to bring left overs home and they took so long we ended up just leaving. It was ridiculous. We won't be back here again. We could've had a better experience across the street at chick fa le.
